title: When Sushant Singh Rajput had his Armstrong moment | bollywood | Hindustan Times

organizations.name: chanda mama door ke apollo program

text:
Desimartini When Sushant Singh Rajput had his Armstrong moment 
For the project, filmmaker Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan has spent a lot of time researching at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). bollywood Updated: Feb 22, 2017 15:28 IST PTI For the project, filmmaker Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan has spent a lot of time researching at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). 
Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput has started working for the upcoming space adventure film Chanda Mama Door Ke and the actor has said after starting the preparations he can now feel what the astronauts on the ‘Apollo 11’ must have experienced. Sushant Singh will soon be seen essaying the role of an astronaut in is next film. 
The 31-year-old actor, who plays an astronaut in the film, took to Twitter where he posted a picture with flight journals titled ‘Apollo 11’ and Chanda Mama Door Ke Apollo Program. “I’d always wondered how Armstrong, Buzz and Michael were feeling during those nine days to the Moon. Well, now I know #flightjournal #Apollo11,” Sushant wrote, along side the photo on Twitter. I'd always wondered how Armstrong, Buzz & Michael were feeling during those 9 days to the Moon. Well,now i know:) #flightjournal #Apollo11 pic.twitter.com/Yza3cFiqgK — Sushant Singh Rajput (@itsSSR) February 21, 2017 
For the project, filmmaker Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan has spent a lot of time researching at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). Filming will start sometime in July. The movie also stars R Madhavan. Miracles are made of repetitions? — Sushant Singh Rajput (@itsSSR) February 14, 2017
